data.title: New girl kissing on Verbotene Liebe
data.meta_description: Since Stella and Carla rode off into the sunset, seems like Verbotene Liebe is trying to raise their girl kissing quota again. Miriam Pesch (blonde one, waitress, played by Romina Becks) and Rebecca von Lahnstein (dark one, wanna-be designer, played by Jasmin Lord). Not sure where they are going…
data.text:
Since Stella and Carla rode off into the sunset, seems like Verbotene Liebe is trying to raise their girl kissing quota again.

Miriam Pesch (blonde one, waitress, played by Romina Becks) and Rebecca von Lahnstein (dark one, wanna-be designer, played by Jasmin Lord).

Not sure where they are going with this storyline, both have been with the show for a while and so far only had various romances with guys (but no successfull OTP). Right now I'm mostly weirded out because up to now both have been kinda more the sex kitten or "clumsy for laughs" type on the show, so I really don't know what to think about it. I guess I'll at least watch when they kiss to see whether they have any chemistry.

Spoilers are pretty stereotypical, accidental kiss while partying, yearning, making out, pushing each other away, jealousy, friends conspiring to get them to talk, making up. Only plus side maybe being that there is no sneaking around because Rebecca outs herself almost immediately before she is even sure herself, so supposedly every knows from the start (no secret love a la Carla/Hannah or Paula/Franzi).

The first kiss is supposed to take place on Novemeber 19th. The kiss is in the picture is supposed to take place on December 9th. Followed by supposed "passionate making out" on December 10th.

I do like that Rebecca asks Charlie for advice on her new found sapphic desires. I wasn't a fan of Stella/Charlie when it happened but not that Stella and Carla are gone I'm happy that the show hasn't completely forgotten about that story. I still would have preferred Nico or Helena as the one with the lesbian story.

All pictures snagged from vl_discuss

Old Christmas advertising for the show:
